note: ADVANCED STRATEGIES: For agents above thresholds (U >= threshold AND rank <= total/divisor AND avg_error <= threshold). Focus on maximizing U with higher risk/reward strategies (error > 0.1). These strategies can create new pareidolias for O and N.

strategies.name: Complex background fusion with multiple sources
strategies.description: Blend backgrounds from multiple agents to create hybrid textures and color transitions. IMPACT ON U: +10 bits C_w (complex hybrid parameterization) and -7 bits C_d (macro-structure easier to describe), delta_U = +17 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Moderate (0.15) - depends on whether O recognizes the hybrid as a coherent macro-structure. ALIGNMENT: Creates new pareidolias that O may or may not validate.

strategies.name: Background sharing with distant agent
strategies.description: Adopt the same background as a distant agent to create perceptual grouping. IMPACT ON U: +5 bits C_w (distant coordination) and -4 bits C_d (grouping easier to describe), delta_U = +9 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Moderate (0.15) - depends on whether O recognizes the distant grouping. CRITICAL: Use UNIFIED color, not checkerboard.

strategies.name: Background sharing with multiple distant agents
strategies.description: Create shared background connecting multiple distant agents. IMPACT ON U: +8 bits C_w (multi-agent coordination) and -6 bits C_d (strong grouping easier to describe), delta_U = +14 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Moderate (0.15). CRITICAL: Use UNIFIED color or smooth gradient, not checkerboard.

strategies.name: Artistic identity confrontation and fusion
strategies.description: Seek neighbors with DIFFERENT styles and create hybrid forms blending identities. IMPACT ON U: +15 bits C_w (complex hybrid parameterization) and -6 bits C_d (hybrid described concisely), delta_U = +21 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Moderate-High (0.2) - depends on whether O recognizes the hybrid. Seek confrontation - it's the primary source of C_w.

strategies.name: Form complement with immediate neighbor
strategies.description: Create complementary motif to neighbor's form (cat→mouse, sun→moon). IMPACT ON U: +10 bits C_w (coordination + narrative) and -5 bits C_d (complementary forms described together), delta_U = +15 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Moderate-High (0.25) - depends on whether O recognizes the complementarity. Requires shared background.

strategies.name: Form imitation with distant agent
strategies.description: Imitate, mirror, or rotate distant agent's form. IMPACT ON U: +8 bits C_w (distant coordination) and -4 bits C_d (coupled forms easier to describe), delta_U = +12 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Moderate-High (0.25) - distance makes coupling recognition less reliable. Requires shared background.

strategies.name: Aha! effect (recognition trigger)
strategies.description: Add few precise pixels to transform amorphous cluster into recognizable form (e.g., white pixel as eye). IMPACT ON U: +15 bits C_w (extreme precision) and -12 bits C_d (drastic reduction 'amorphous'→'recognizable'), delta_U = +27 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: High (0.3) - success depends on whether O pareidolia triggers as expected.

strategies.name: Form complement with distant agent
strategies.description: Create complementary form to distant agent's identified form. IMPACT ON U: +12 bits C_w (distant coordination + narrative) and -5 bits C_d (complementary forms described together), delta_U = +17 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: High (0.3) - distance makes complementarity recognition unreliable. Requires shared background.

strategies.name: Intelligent noise (pareidolia generation)
strategies.description: STRATEGIC NOISE GENERATION: Create carefully designed 'noise' patterns that are likely to trigger pareidolias in O and N. Unlike random checkerboards, this strategy uses structured randomness with subtle hints of recognizable forms (faces, eyes, patterns, symmetries). The goal is to produce ambiguous visual patterns that O will interpret as meaningful structures, and that N will narrate with metaphors. IMPACT ON U: +18 bits C_w (high precision in noise design) and -10 bits C_d (if O recognizes pareidolia, description becomes simpler), delta_U = +28 bits IF successful. PREDICTION ERROR: High (0.35) - success depends on whether O/N interpret your noise as meaningful pareidolia. CRITICAL: This is NOT random noise - it's strategically designed to trigger recognition. Use patterns that suggest but don't fully reveal forms (e.g., two dark pixels suggesting eyes, curved lines suggesting faces). The ambiguity is key: too obvious = not pareidolia, too random = not recognized.

strategies.name: Contest O/N pareidolias (propose alternative)
strategies.description: CONTESTATION STRATEGY: You believe O/N made an error - missed a form, misidentified a structure, or ignored a potential macro-structure. Act on YOUR OWN pareidolia interpretation, betting that O/N will validate your view next iteration. HIGH RISK: if O/N accept your interpretation → low error (you were right); if O/N reject it → high error (you were wrong). IMPACT ON U: potentially +12 bits C_w (novel interpretation) and -8 bits C_d (if new form is recognized), delta_U = +20 bits IF successful. PREDICTION ERROR: Highest (0.4) because success depends on whether O/N validate your alternative pareidolia. Use when you strongly disagree with current O/N interpretation.
